column1: #Text=The human capacity for invention has defined us and the world we live in for hundreds of thousands of years.
#Text=Technology is the one thing that has given humans the ability to dominate the planet as we have.
#Text=And it's only accelerated since the invention of agriculture, industry, information technology.
#Text=I don' know what the exact period of a cycle is, but there appears to be a geometric progression to the increase in pace.
#Text=Like it or not, technology is the thing that is our greatest strength and weakness.

#Text=Technology has give us the ability to live in any ecological niche in the world, travel to any point on the globe, to decipher the mysteries of creation (to a great extent), master the very building blocks of life (genetics), explore other planets (and stars one day), communicate instantly with anyone anywhere, etc, etc.
#Text=It's also endangering life on earth through climate change, led to the invention of nuclear weapons, caused epidemic levels of heart disease and cancer, etc, etc.
#Text=The challenge is navigating it, but lamenting it will do no good.
